boardgame.name: Kremel
Kreml
Kremlin
クレムリン
boardgame.description: A game of political intrigue set in the Soviet Politburo. The game consists of a large number of politician cards, some of which form the first politburo. Politicians have certain stats (preferred offices, for instance) and an age._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;At the start of the game, the players secretly note influence on ten politicians, graded from 10 (most) to 1 (least). Gameplay is not clockwise, but happens from top to bottom in the politburo. Whatever action the politician in a certain office can take is done by the player who reveals the greatest influence on the politician in question. Actions include accusing other politicians of espionage (potentially exiling them to Siberia), pardoning them, reshuffling the politburo and others. But each action a politician takes lets him (or in one case, her) age by one or more years. Once a turn each politburo member must face a health roll which can result in sickness marker or even instant death (the older, the most likely). At the end of each turn, the reigning head of state must wave to the crowd at the October parade without collapsing (which gets harder the sicker the politician is). A politician who succeeds in this three times makes the player who controls him/her the winner._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The original Fata Morgana edition included rules requiring the players to hold funeral speeches for deceased party chairmen and drinking vodka with it, for instance. The later Avalon Hill edition scrapped these rules and gave the game a less satirical and more serious tone._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Jolly Roger reimplemented an edition providing three different KREMLIN games in one box -See Kremlin (Third Edition)-:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;1: The 'original' with fictional politicians, set in a USSR where KGB investigations send those found guilty to Siberia. This version will have victory conditions based on the original Fata Morgana rules._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;2: A version inspired by the Avalon Hill variant titled 'Revolution'. Set in the 1920s, it uses historical politicians as well as fictional politicians. It's a more violent game as those arrested by the KGB are shot and removed from the game_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;3: A new version, set in the modern USSR and Russia, an era of entrenched bureaucracy and alternatives for escaping KGB persecution. This version introduces the concept of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Going into Exile_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; to avoid Siberia. It also includes modern politicians from the 1960s onwards, whether it is Kosygin or Putin and Gorbachev._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Kremlin Avalon Hill 1988 Complete, components in very good condition. The rules aren_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t specific about how many die-cut playing pieces there are, but everything seems to be correct - there are 260 pieces in total, and each faction has the same number. Includes Basic Game Rules, Advanced Game Rules, game board, 26 Politician cards, 34 Intrigue cards, 20-sided die, 30 pieces for each faction, 50 age stress point pieces, 15 cure/suspicion pieces, 14 sick/ill pieces, 1 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;phase_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; piece, Influence Points pad, advertising brochure, mail reply card, 1988 catalog, influence pad reorder sheet. Pieces are bagged by type. Box is in very good condition - minor shelf wear only. (14)

Feb 2013 update - all counters are now accounted for, and I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve added a 20 sided die to make up for the missing original. This is the AH first edition of the game; blue box with Gorbachev on the cover, as pictured here: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/55578/kremlin Includes the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Revolution_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; expansion. Missing the original 20 sided die, but I have a replacement. Box is split on one corner but otherwise intact. Rules have a slight _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;curl_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; to the vertical edge; I can supply pictures on request. Other than that, I believe complete, but here_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s the full contents: * 26 politician cards from the base game, with the funny names and flavor text * 26 politician cards from Revolution with real people (Lenin, Malenkov, etc.) on one side with yellow borders, and the 26 phonies on the reverse * 67 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Intrigue_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; cards - 1-34 loose in the box and are all white, 35-67 have yellow borders and are mainly unpunched although a few have come unattached. * bagged counters, one or two have some slight ripping that I noticed but in general look great for a 25 year old game: + 30 blue with white sickle + 30 brown with black hammer and sickle + 30 green with white star + 30 yellow with black onion-dome + 30 dark green with white bear (?) head + 30 black with white hammer + 50 white with black numbers 0-9 + 14 white with 1/2 red crosses + 15 white with some combination of green question marks / blue _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;CURE_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; + 1 white with _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;PHASE_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; on it * basic rules, advanced rules, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Revolution_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; rules. See below. * pad of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Kremlin Influence Sheet_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;, not sure how many were used but there are a lot left * various extra junk like a game and parts list from 1988, AH registration card, etc. * LOTS of extra copies of the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Revolution_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; rules and _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Kremlin Revolution Variant Influence Sheet_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;s. These appear to be photocopies and are a little too big for the box, so their vertical edge is a little curled, and in turn they slightly curled the official rules (which do fit in the box without problem) * the game board Estimated shipping is $12.00.

Jolly Roger Games (JOL1917) A game of political intrigue set in the Soviet Politburo. Players secretly influence politicians, using them to exile other players politicians, promote their own or wheel and deal. This is a re-envisioning of the Fata Morgana game and Avalon Hill licensed product from the mid-1980s.It will allow for three different eras (fictional, 1928, and modern) with politicians and events for each era. Each era has its own rules / foibles to make it slightly different than the others.
